problem_text: (H. Bass). Let G be a group, e an idempotent matrix over ZG and let tr e = P g∈G egg, eg ∈ Z. Strong conjecture: for any non-trivial x ∈ G, the equation P g∼x eg = 0 holds where ∼ denotes conjugacy in G. Weak conjecture: P g∈G eg = 0. The strong conjecture has been proved for finite, abelian and linear groups and the weak conjecture has been proved for residually finite groups. H. Bass’ Comment of 2005: Significant progress has been made; a good up-to-date account is in the paper (A. J. Berrick, I. Chatterji, G. Mislin, Math. Ann., 329 (2004), 597–621). G. A. Noskov
